snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky Im sure you get requests to listen to soundtracks all the time, but I think you should really check out the OST for "edge". It is a relentless puzzle game with a pop/jazz soundtrack that is definately worth checking out.

snippet.textDisplay: Quite a memorable game. Like for many, it was also my first Tales of game and it captured everything that I liked about RPGs then. That, and it was a somehow good turn compared to other RPGs that were coming out, since there were not too many great games of that genre back on that generation of consoles during that time.
snippet.textOriginal: Quite a memorable game. Like for many, it was also my first Tales of game and it captured everything that I liked about RPGs then. That, and it was a somehow good turn compared to other RPGs that were coming out, since there were not too many great games of that genre back on that generation of consoles during that time.

snippet.textDisplay: Guy sure loves his obscure RPGs, don't he.

snippet.textOriginal: @TheUnBeheadedSlayer No need for that.

snippet.textDisplay: Obscure? It's part of a franchise that has been around 19 years now. Besides the 14 Main titles, and numerous spin-off games, there's adapted Anime's and OVA's. It's even regarded as being the third biggest RPG franchise in Japan, just behind Final Fantasy and Dragon Quest. I suggest giving the games a try (Especially Tales of the Abyss) as lots of the games are truly fantastic. To me they are better than FF or DQ, which is saying alot cause I love me some FF, lol.
snippet.textOriginal: Obscure? It's part of a franchise that has been around 19 years now. Besides the 14 Main titles, and numerous spin-off games, there's adapted Anime's and OVA's. It's even regarded as being the third biggest RPG franchise in Japan, just behind Final Fantasy and Dragon Quest. I suggest giving the games a try (Especially Tales of the Abyss) as lots of the games are truly fantastic. To me they are better than FF or DQ, which is saying alot cause I love me some FF, lol.

snippet.textDisplay: Tales of Vesperia is really great. It was the first entry in the series I played, so I was unsure about it, but it's amazing. Just don't be put off by the main character's purple hair.
snippet.textOriginal: Tales of Vesperia is really great. It was the first entry in the series I played, so I was unsure about it, but it's amazing. Just don't be put off by the main character's purple hair.

snippet.textDisplay: nice!
snippet.textOriginal: nice!

snippet.textDisplay: Despite his reputation, and as a true Tales of fan ( ToP, ToD, ToE, ToS, ToS2, TotA, ToV, ToGf, ToX done ), i don't really enjoy Vesperia ( but its OST is great ), and maybe its my least favorite game of the serie. The main problem I have with the game is the core of a Tales of game : the gameplay in fights. It was so much annoying, and clearly worse than its predecesor : Abyss.
snippet.textOriginal: Despite his reputation, and as a true Tales of fan ( ToP, ToD, ToE, ToS, ToS2, TotA, ToV, ToGf, ToX done ), i don't really enjoy Vesperia ( but its OST is great ), and maybe its my least favorite game of the serie. The main problem I have with the game is the core of a Tales of game : the gameplay in fights. It was so much annoying, and clearly worse than its predecesor : Abyss.

snippet.textDisplay: I will admit that I am not too much of a fan of the JRPG genre anymore due to me blatantly sucking at them as I just don't have the time to grind nowadays but one thing I will admit, they have always been fantastic at creating massive worlds with beautiful soundtracks and Tales of Vesperia is most definitely one of those games, I would say it fits in with my favorites of last generation, including Lost Odyssey and Ni No Kuni and my absolute favorite: Valkyria Chronicles.. What a stunning game!
snippet.textOriginal: I will admit that I am not too much of a fan of the JRPG genre anymore due to me blatantly sucking at them as I just don't have the time to grind nowadays but one thing I will admit, they have always been fantastic at creating massive worlds with beautiful soundtracks and Tales of Vesperia is most definitely one of those games, I would say it fits in with my favorites of last generation, including Lost Odyssey and Ni No Kuni and my absolute favorite: Valkyria Chronicles.. What a stunning game!

snippet.textDisplay: Ah, I've always come to love the desert and snow towns in RPGs. It's a shame Vesperia didn't really have a snow town, though.
snippet.textOriginal: Ah, I've always come to love the desert and snow towns in RPGs. It's a shame Vesperia didn't really have a snow town, though.

snippet.textDisplay: A simple, yet memorable tune from one of my favorite games in the series. Fitting for the hot sunny day we have here. I haven't played Graces or Xillia yet, but I will eventually as I'll need my "Tale of" fix soon. Tales of Zestiria seems to be changing the formula a bit, it'll be interesting to see how it turns out.
snippet.textOriginal: A simple, yet memorable tune from one of my favorite games in the series. Fitting for the hot sunny day we have here. I haven't played Graces or Xillia yet, but I will eventually as I'll need my "Tale of" fix soon. Tales of Zestiria seems to be changing the formula a bit, it'll be interesting to see how it turns out.

snippet.textDisplay: @Szadek23 I agree that Graces had a super fun combat system. But I also thought its characters were great. They had great chemistry and the skits were actually really funny. Xillia is just an all around great game.
snippet.textOriginal: @Szadek23 I agree that Graces had a super fun combat system. But I also thought its characters were great. They had great chemistry and the skits were actually really funny. Xillia is just an all around great game.

snippet.textDisplay: @heyjeySigma That's where the story really kicks off. It's a slow paced game to be sure but it does pick up eventually.
snippet.textOriginal: @heyjeySigma That's where the story really kicks off. It's a slow paced game to be sure but it does pick up eventually.
